taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek aktis, ray, and stachys, spike, referring to the rays of the fertile leaves]

bio:treatment.description: Plants terrestrial. Roots dark, fibrous, covered with dark, stiff hairs, 2--3 mm. Stems upright; hairs uniseriate. Leaves all fertile (even youngest), unbranched, long-petioled. Blades falsely digitate, reduced to 2--many erect to spreading terminal rays; rays appearing to be whorled but actually borne on very short rachis. Sporangia in 2--4 rows. Gametophytes subterranean, not green, tuberlike, brown-hairy. x = 134, 140.
